Description: Bone plaque; use for decorating furniture or receptables associated with Alexandria; carved with stylised vegetal motifs and vine scrolls (called nabati, from the Arabic for plant, also known as arabesque) and an astragal border; two dowel holes; Umayyad object demonstrating continuity with Byzantine-period examples.
Bibliographic references: Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.25, fig.3)
